title: Plenary presentation by Slovenia/UNESCO: an overview of the 2nd World OER Congress and its objectives

author: Gašper Hrastelj, Slovenian National Commission for UNESCO
Mitja Jermol, UNESCO Chair on Open Technologies for Open Educational Resources and Open Learning

segmentation: As we already announced, many times the 2nd.
Well, we are.
Congress will take place from 18th to 20th September next year in Lubiana.
Ljubljana is the capital of Slovenia.
It's a small little village and is probably not.
All or not, many of you have been in the surrounding of Slovenia.
I would like to just some.
Hold child Show where Slovenia is.
It's a small little country in central Europe.
We can hardly see it, but it's it's.
It's neighboring Italy, Hungary, Austria and our former brother country Croatia.
So it's quite centralized so it's not difficult to reach.
There are many big international airports in the vicinity of Slovenia, so I hope that you will find the very easy way to come to our.
Place.
As function said already.
We are two full partners in organizing this event.
This is.
The this is UNESCO and the Government of Slovenia and here in this case it's especially the Ministry of Education, Science and Sport.
But as I will present a little later, it's a project of the whole is living in government.
Of course partner in this organization is the Commonwealth of Learning.
As we can already see in the organization of the regional consultations.
However, on the Commonwealth will also be a full partner in the organization or is a full partner in the organization of the Congress itself.
Um, there are other international partners as the Creative Commons and of course.
It's the Hewlett Foundation without which support everything or nothing would be would be possible.
However, I have to say that also this convenient government is participating and giving quite a nice amount of finances for the organization of the Congress.
Um partners in Slovenia.
As I said, it's not only the Ministry for Education, Science and Sport, it's the whole government.
So we are now in line and and and have a national organizing team.
But it comprises also other partner institutions, especially as the municipal chair.
On open technologies for open educational resources and open learning you have met Meteor and some of you already met.
Also his colleague diver, very active colleagues and also without them the organization would not be possible.
Then it's the overall initiative.
It's called opening up Slovenia Meteor will present to you a little later.
What this is about.
Other partners, like the knowledge for All Foundation which is based.
Starting process with about the cooperation among.
Slovenia and UNESCO in the field of open education.
So it was the establishment of the chair itself in 214.
Then and 2:15 the conference open education global.

There it was the time and the place where we have been approached, actually by UNESCO itself and been asked if Slovenia would be probably interested in hosting the Second World IOR Congress in the Year 5 years after the first one.
So in 217 and we have talked then not only to our colleagues, but I have.
We have asked at once or our minister and she said yes.
Of course.

Yes, of course we will do it that it's a great opportunity not only for Slovenia itself, but a great opportunity to really then five years after the First World Congress to have it in our country in the beginning of 216 together with UNESCO.
With both sectors the sector and DCI sector, we organized the so called road map meeting.
It was a first meeting.
To see what we would like to have, what we would like to achieve with the organization of the Second World Congress.

And it happened in Paris at UNESCO headquarters, bringing together many stakeholders, not only representatives from from Member States of UNESCO or the regional groups of UNESCO, but also stakeholders like you from partner organizations from the Commonwealth.
Learning from Hewlett from the Hewlett Foundation and Creative Commons and others.
I'm having a one day meeting.
Just probably getting to know in which situation we are in the field of O ER in April.
Then after this meeting in April 216, Slovenia put an item on the agenda of the of UNESCO's Executive Executive, part of this session in April of this year, and this item was about.
Irresolution just giving on the agenda of the Executive Board for for the debate with of the Member States about a Rd.
About this background document which was.
Adopted on the the road map meeting, but bringing into decision a resolution on the next steps of international collaboration in the field of Ovr and the overall goal.
I mean in the beginning before the resolution was adopted in the in the form like it is the goal was I mean the the title of the resolution was the possibility of a adoption of a.
International standard setting instrument in the field.

Overall, you are which was the goal of not only of Slovenia, border of many, many Member States, but in the end the outcome was this resolution and the main task of the resolution was is was to conduct a feasibility study in the field of IOR which is presently prepared by an expert and I hope for I hope that it will be finalized until the end of of this year, so it could be already then.
Debated also during the next regional consultations, and it will be of course also a topic of the World Congress itself.
Then in September 216, all governments have been informed by UNESCO as a save.
The date first call with the date of the World Congress.
It was sent out to the delegations of member States or hopefully every government and every Member State has received this first call for the World Congress.
And in the same month their call for.
For the filling in of the service of two servers that one we have just worked on in the last half of an hour and there was there is another one for for the government itself.
So two surveys are being conducted at this time.
Also UNESCO send it out to the rest of the members.
Its Member states are not only to the Commonwealth Member states, so these these surveys are presently being filled in by governments.
Stakeholders and also the results of this service will be part of the future deliberations and discussions in November this year.
Yeah, as I said, UNESCO has sent out in the invitation to fill in this survey and presently this is prepared.
Um?
For the next steps, we are looking forward, of course to the next to this, to the.
This final day of this regional consultation and of course, also to the next regional consultations.
In January 2017, we expect the finalization of the feasibility study I was talking about UNESCO oedi sectors preparing another study.

In the field of OUR then in January February, you can expect a. I mean all Member States can expect a formal invitation which will be sent out by UNESCO by UNESCO Director general and and by our Minister.
I'm happy that I can.
I hope for.
I hope that after the coffee break or so I will hand out to you a special invitation.
But our.
By our minister.
Because we are looking forward that that also you will be in the position.
All of you will be in the position to take part in the Congress.
And April 217 next year.
The feasibility study will be again.

At the next session of the of UNESCO's Executive Board and there will be another resolution, so we will see what the what the this resolution will will be like, but it will carry of course the results of the regional consultations and of the preparations to the Congress which will be finalized, I mean.
Which will be prepared by then, so hopefully we can make another good resolution which will lead to to somehow a.
Better and enhanced international cooperation.
About all you are in the in in the framework of UNESCO.
And.
July may to July the the results of the study and also the resolution by the by UNESCO's Executive Board will be sent out to all Member States.

For the preparation to the Congress, we are looking forward to having another face to face meeting of the steering committee for the preparation of the Congress in summer before before the summer break.
And in September itself, then, then the Congress will will take place in Slovenia.
Short overview what can happen afterwards.
Becausw also for Slovenia.
the Congress itself is not the goal per say.
I mean we are looking forward already to the to the activities which will take place after the Congress.
So we are thinking about, for example, having follow-up meetings on expert level after after the Congress and what the plan is is that.
With the ending of next year, as I said, follow up conferences, but in 218 or something we will have another international meeting on expert level.

Probably this time, not an ministerial level, which will bring together really experts from all Member States for the draft of a final resolution for in the field of international collaboration on IR, which will be then debated.
By UNESCO's general Conference in 219 and there, the goal is that.
Finally, we are looking forward probably a somehow a instrument or some recommendations or a resolution.
Could be adopted by all Member States of UNESCO, which will really put forward the international cooperation in the field of ovr.
Just the objectives of the world or our Congress are very much in line with the objectives of the regional meetings.
In the first roll, it's a review of the progress in Oh yeah, R. Since the first world or we are Congress.
Of course, it's then the examination of solutions to meet.
The challenges you were also debating less yesterday afternoon.
Then it's also a a room.
There will be room and time for showcasing worlds best practices in having a marketplace and and also bringing a presenting policies and initiatives.
Then the Congress should finalize in in in the adoption of of.

Recommendations and the identification of strategies for the mainstreaming of R and in the end probably an adoption of action plan, which is our which is our goal, so we would like we don't wish to have another declaration on our way out which was already adopted five years ago, but we would like to really go on and give recommendations what what to do in this field, just.
Brief overview it will be a three day, nearly three day meeting here.
With this overview, I'm starting with day one because this will be a Sunday with the arrival of participants and a an opening.
Then in the 1st.
At the first day we will have, as here for example, we would like have to would like to have a good and really remarkable keynote speakers who will.
Start at the beginning of every day of the Congress.
We will, of course, make presentation of our results and recommendations of the six regional consultations.
Then, of course, not only of this feasibility studies, which, as mentioned already, there are other studies in the field of Ohio are taking place at this time.
As far as I am informed and the presentation of the results of the studies will be of course presented.
A presentation of a glow glow.
Our story will be there and we are preparing for for at least two days.
Larger networking events, in which form we will see it could be as a marketplace.
It could be as I said, he as I written.
It's written here.
It could be a ovr barcamp and so on.
So there are different ideas in our minds at less.
They again an opportunity, probably foreign exchange in the form of a marketplace or World Cup face or so on.
The closing we are looking forward to really then having the adoption of a somehow so called lubiana.
Will it be an action plan?
Will it be a call for action?
So really the list of recommendations which will be delivered also by the regional consultation.
It could be also a road map with recommendations on the future of international cooperation in the field of OUR so.
So far what I have to say in in in general about the standing how far we are in the organization of the Congress, or up to now.
I would like to thank you for this for your attention.
I will hand over now the mic to my colleague Meteor, who will tell you more about why Slovenia is really the real and the best place to to have the Second World over.
